projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance, flexible, and embeddable UI layout library in Rust, implementing standard CSS layout algorithms like Flexbox, Grid, and Block for use in other UI frameworks and applications.
mainFeatures: Implements CSS Block, Flexbox, and CSS Grid algorithms
Designed for embedding in UI/GUI libraries

alternatives.name: Yoga
mainFeatures: Implements a subset of CSS Flexbox

alternatives.name: Flutter Rendering Engine (Layout)
mainFeatures: Part of a complete UI toolkit

alternatives.name: Qt Layout System
mainFeatures: Provides various layout classes (Box, Grid, Form)
Used with Qt Widgets and QML
Supports design tools like Qt Designer

marketPositioning: Taffy is positioned as a high-performance, Rust-native UI layout library that differentiates itself by offering comprehensive support for modern CSS layout algorithms (Block, Flexbox, and Grid), unlike some alternatives that focus primarily on Flexbox. It serves as a modular, embeddable engine for other UI frameworks and applications, particularly those within the Rust ecosystem, providing a performant alternative to C++-based engines like Yoga and the integrated layout systems of larger frameworks like Flutter and Qt.
